intro: Clidemia pleiostemon, commonly known as the red mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom throughout the year. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests and along stream banks. Clidemia pleiostemon is also known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive appearance.
